article.content: Sahab AI Services Presentation App

This internal tool for Part Company's Artificial Intelligence Center, developed between 2019 and 2022, served as a presentation platform for various AI services. The app, written in Java and Kotlin, was designed to showcase AI capabilities to customers in Farsi.
Introduction

Sahab was a program for Artificial Intelligence Center Part company that started in 2019 and ended in 2022. I worked as an Android developer on this application. This program was an internal tool for presentation to the company's customers and it was in Farsi. The program, written in Java and Kotlin, showcased various artificial intelligence services across four main sub-categories:

items: Speech processing
Machine vision
Natural language processing
Data mining

article.content: Splash Screen , Menu Screen and Home Screen
Each branch displayed its regular services. For example, in the machine vision department, we had services with video and image analysis.
Captcha Processing, Emotion Recognition and Age Recognition
Custom UI

This application, which is in Persian, displays more than 80 artificial intelligence services, each with its own unique UI. The project lasted almost three years, during which about 1000 tasks were completed. These tasks included implementing each section, designing themes, SMS authentication, and debugging.
Custom Player, Custom Spinner and Custom Highlighter
Library
Various libraries were used in this application, some of which are listed below.

items: Glide: A fast and efficient image loading library for Android.
Retrofit: A type-safe HTTP client library for Android that simplifies API calls by using annotations.
Room: An ORM (Object Relational Mapper) that simplifies working with SQLite databases in Android.
Dagger 2: A powerful framework for managing dependencies.
Lottie: A library for animating complex vector graphics.
Espresso: An official testing framework from Google for writing UI tests for Android applications.
Firebase Cloud Messaging: For Push Notifications in Android.

article.content: After the release of its web version, the development of its Android version ended in 2022.
Farsi Language Speech Collection Project

This project, initiated in 2019, aimed to gather audio data to develop voice-to-text and text-to-speech models in Farsi. It involved speakers reading provided texts and listeners verifying the accuracy of these recordings.
Introduction

The Program Speech Gathering began its implementation in Farsi in 2019. The project aimed to collect audio data for the audio collection team. Users would log into the software and start working according to their assigned role, which could be either a speaker or a listener. To gather the necessary data, approximately 100 speakers with various accents were involved, and around 2,000 listeners participated. The program successfully collected close to 1 million data points to train voice-to-text and text-to-Farsi voice models.
Speaker page, Home page and Menu
Speaker's Role
Speakers received text prompts, read them aloud, and sent the resulting audio files to the server.
Listener's Role

Listeners received the speaker's audio file along with the text that was read. They verified if the audio matched the text and sent the result to the server. This data was later used to train voice-to-text and text-to-voice models.
My Role
As an Android developer, I was responsible for the app implementation process from start to finish. During this period, I completed 150 different issues.
Libraries Used

items: ROOM: for the local database
Retrofit: for sending and receiving information and files from the server
Firebase: for push notifications
Custom Voice Recorder: designed according to the speech processing team's requests
User Guides: written for each section to introduce the application to users

article.content: The program concluded in 2022 after collecting the necessary data for the artificial intelligence team.
Checknama App Development Project

This project, initiated in 2018, was designed to facilitate bank check inquiries and services related to driver's licenses and license plates. It involved users capturing and submitting photos for machine vision analysis, streamlining the service request process.
Introduction

The Checknama app began in 2018 when I joined Part Company. The app was developed to handle bank check inquiries and services related to driver's licenses and license plates. Users would take photos with their phone cameras and send them to the server for analysis. All user inquiries were saved in their profiles, making it easier for them to track the inquiry process in the future.
Splash, Message and Home screen
Cheque Inquiry

To inquire about a bank check, the user would take a photo of the check, crop it, and send it to the server. The machine vision team extracted the check number from the photo and returned it to the app. The user would then see the extracted number, confirm its accuracy, and proceed with the inquiry using the bank's APIs. If the check was valid, the necessary information was displayed to the user.
Confirmation of information by the user, show bank check inquiry and use the phone's camera
Vehicle Violation Inquiry

Inquiring about a car violation followed a similar process. The user sent a photo of their car card to the machine vision team, which extracted the necessary data. After user confirmation, the car violation information was retrieved using government-provided APIs and displayed to the user.
List of vehicle violations, confirmation of information by the user and display of vehicle violation inquiry
License Violation Inquiry

To determine license violations and negative scores, users sent a photo of their driver's license to the machine vision team. Upon user approval, the app retrieved and displayed the necessary information from government APIs.
List of license violations, confirmation of information by the user and display of license violation inquiry
My Role

As the Android developer, I was responsible for implementing all the pages of the app. Over the course of a year, I addressed nearly 200 issues, including developing new pages, adding features, and debugging the program.
The project concluded in 2019 with the completion of the Checknama program, aligning with the company's priorities.
Handwriting Collection App

Initiated in 2021, this app aimed to gather user handwriting samples for training a machine vision model. Developed in Kotlin, the program featured roles for authors and reviewers and concluded after six months due to a shift in project priorities.
Introduction

The Handwriting Collection App began development in 2021 with the purpose of collecting user handwriting to train a machine vision model. Written in Kotlin, the app featured two primary roles: writer and reviewer. After six months of implementation, the project was halted due to changes in the machine vision team's priorities and management decisions.
Role of the Writer
Writers were shown a text and had two methods for submitting handwriting samples:

items: Writing on paper and taking a picture of it
Writing directly on the phone screen using a stylus

article.content: After submitting a sample, the file was sent to the server and another text was displayed for the user to write.
Role of the Handwriting Reviewer
Reviewers checked the text and photo submitted by the writer and confirmed the handwriting if it matched the provided text.
My Role

As the Android developer, I was responsible for designing and fully implementing the app in Kotlin. This included functionalities such as cropping photos taken by the user and capturing handwriting from the phone screen before sending it to the server. The project involved 200 issues, covering various pages and debugging across seven versions of the app.
The program ended after six months due to management decisions.
Beroz E-Commerce Site
Initiated in late 2023 by Sarbdaren Kavosh Company, Beroz was designed as a mobile and desktop e-commerce platform using React and NodeJS to sell various electrical gadgets.
Introduction

Site Beroz began its design phase in late 2023 at Sarbdaren Kavosh Company. This e-commerce platform, intended to sell various electrical gadgets, was developed using React and NodeJS. The design was optimized for both mobile and desktop users and was handed over to the web programming team for implementation.
Part of the main page of the site
Main page in mobile size and login page
My Role

As a React programmer, I collaborated with the front-end team, using Tailwind for CSS. We utilized numerous libraries to implement the site, some of which are listed below along with their descriptions:

items: react-router-dom: Facilitates dynamic routing in web applications.
react-icons: Provides a collection of popular icon sets for React.
uuid: Generates unique identifiers for use in React components.
swiper: Enables touch sliders and carousels for modern web apps.
Material UI: Offers React components that implement Google's Material Design.

article.content: In addition to front-end development, I worked with the back-end team to design APIs. We implemented the back-end using the Express framework. Below are some of the back-end libraries that were used, along with their descriptions:

items: dotenv: Loads environment variables from a .env file into process.env.
express: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework.
fastest-validator: Provides high-performance data validation for Node.js.
cors: Allows cross-origin requests in web applications.
jsonwebtoken: Handles JSON Web Tokens for authentication purposes.
multer: Middleware for handling multipart/form-data for file uploads.

article.content: Unfortunately, the site was not completed by the time I immigrated to Canada in early 2024, at which point I ceased working with the team.

The Pantomimkadeh application, a word suggestion game, was designed and implemented by me in 2017. Developed in Java, the program has gained significant traction in the market, with close to 50,000 installs to date.
Scoring, Word download and Main Page

Pantomimkadeh offers an engaging word suggestion game experience, and its successful deployment showcases my ability to develop and launch comprehensive applications independently.

Introducing My Brick Breaker Game: Built with React and Tailwind CSS

I'm excited to share my latest project: a classic Brick Breaker game developed using **React** and **Tailwind CSS**. This project combines modern web development technologies to deliver a responsive and interactive gaming experience that works seamlessly on both desktop and mobile devices.
Project Overview: Brick Breaker Game Demo
How It Works

The game is straightforward and intuitive. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen, which can be moved left and right to keep a ball in play. The objective is to break all the bricks positioned at the top of the screen by bouncing the ball off the paddle and into the bricks. The game ends when the ball touches the bottom of the screen, and a modal will appear showing the player's score. If the player breaks all the bricks, a winning modal is displayed with the final score.
Screenshot in phone size
Features
Here are some of the key features of the Brick Breaker game:

items: **Paddle Control**: The paddle can be controlled using swipe gestures on mobile devices or mouse movements on desktop browsers. This provides a responsive and smooth control experience regardless of the device.
**Brick Collision**: The game accurately detects collisions between the ball and the bricks. When a brick is hit, it is removed from the screen, and the player earns points.

**Score Tracking**: The game keeps track of the current score and also maintains the best score using local storage. This ensures that the player's highest achievement is saved even after the game is refreshed or closed.

**Speed Control**: Players can adjust the speed of the ball using the "Increase Speed" and "Decrease Speed" buttons at the top of the screen. This allows for a customizable gaming experience based on the player's skill level and preference.

**Game Over and Win Modals**: When the ball falls out of play or all bricks are cleared, a modal appears showing the player's score. The game over modal provides an option to reset the game and start over.
**Responsive Design**: The game is designed to be fully responsive, ensuring it looks and functions well on all screen sizes, from mobile phones to desktop monitors.
**Multiple Brick Colors**: To add visual interest, the bricks come in 10 different colors, all styled using Tailwind CSS. This makes the game more engaging and visually appealing.

article.content: Why React and Tailwind CSS?

**React** is a powerful JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows for the creation of reusable components, making the development process more efficient and the codebase easier to maintain. With React, the game's state and rendering logic are handled seamlessly, providing a smooth and interactive user experience.

**Tailwind CSS** is a utility-first CSS framework that makes it easy to style the application. By using Tailwind, I could quickly and efficiently create a visually appealing design without writing a lot of custom CSS. The framework's predefined classes enabled me to focus more on the game's functionality while ensuring a modern and responsive design.
Check Out the Code

If you're interested in the technical details and want to see how everything is implemented, you can find the source code for this project in [my GitHub repository](https://github.com/abolfazlbzgh/brick-breaker-game). The repository includes all the code for the game, and you can explore how the various components work together to create the final product.
Conclusion

Creating this Brick Breaker game was a fun and rewarding experience. It combines the classic gameplay of a timeless arcade game with the power and flexibility of modern web technologies. I'm thrilled to share it with you and hope you enjoy playing it as much as I enjoyed building it.
Introducing My 2048 Game: A Modern Take on a Classic Puzzle

I'm thrilled to share my latest creation with you: a sleek, modern version of the classic 2048 game. Built using **React** and **Tailwind CSS**, this project delivers a smooth, enjoyable gaming experience **across both desktop and mobile platforms**.
Project Overview: 2048 Game Demo
Game Concept

The 2048 game is a highly addictive puzzle where your goal is to combine tiles with the same number to create a tile with the value of 2048. You can swipe in four directions: up, down, left, and right. Each swipe moves all the tiles in that direction, merging identical numbers into one and doubling its value. The game ends when no more moves are possible, pushing players to think strategically.
Screenshot in phone size
Highlighted Features
Here are some of the key features of the 2048 game:

items: **Adaptive Interface**: The game is designed to be fully responsive. Whether you're playing on a desktop or mobile device, the interface adapts to provide an intuitive experience. Mobile users can swipe, while desktop users can use keyboard arrows or on-screen buttons.

**Real-Time Score Updates**: Your current score updates dynamically with each move. Additionally, your highest score is saved locally, ensuring you can keep track of your best performance even after closing the game.
**Fluid Animations**: Enjoy smooth animations that make merging tiles visually satisfying. These animations enhance the overall gameplay experience, keeping it engaging and exciting.
**Undo and Restart Functions**: Made a mistake? No worries! You can undo your last move or restart the game at any point, adding a strategic depth to your gameplay.
**End Game Alerts**: When the game ends or when you create a 2048 tile, a modal pops up, displaying your score and providing options to restart or continue playing.
**Vibrant Tile Colors**: Tiles change color based on their value, thanks to Tailwind CSS. This feature not only makes the game visually appealing but also helps in quickly identifying tile values.

article.content: The Power of React and Tailwind CSS

**React** is an exceptional library for creating dynamic user interfaces, making it perfect for a game like 2048. Its component-based structure simplifies state management and allows for reusable components, which streamlines the development process.

**Tailwind CSS**, a utility-first CSS framework, enhances the design process by allowing quick application of consistent styling across components without the need for custom CSS. This results in a clean, modern, and responsive interface.
Dive Into the Code

Curious about the inner workings of the game? The full project is available on [my GitHub repository](https://github.com/abolfazlbzgh/game-2048). You can explore the code, examine the React components, and see how Tailwind CSS is integrated. The repository provides a comprehensive look at the project, offering insights into contemporary web development techniques.
Final Thoughts

Creating this 2048 game has been a rewarding experience. Merging the timeless gameplay of 2048 with modern web technologies has resulted in a seamless, engaging, and visually stunning game. I'm excited to share it with you and hope you find it as enjoyable to play as it was to develop.
Enhancing Email Authentication with Node.js, React, and Tailwind CSS

I'm excited to introduce my latest project: a comprehensive email authentication system built using **Node.js** for the backend and **React** with **Tailwind CSS** for the frontend. This project not only showcases robust user authentication but also demonstrates the seamless integration of modern web technologies to create a smooth and secure user experience.
Project Overview: Email Authentication Demo
Project Overview

The email authentication system includes essential features such as user registration, login, and email verification. By leveraging Node.js, we ensure a powerful and scalable backend, while React and Tailwind CSS provide a sleek and responsive frontend. This combination delivers a secure and user-friendly authentication flow.
Screenshots of pages
Key Features
**ES Module Syntax:** The project utilizes modern JavaScript `import` statements, ensuring clean and maintainable code.
**Express Server:** An Express server is set up with routes for signup, login, and email verification. MongoDB is used for storing user data, and the connection is managed using `mongoose`.
**User Schema:** A Mongoose user schema is defined to handle and validate user data efficiently in MongoDB.
**Signup Route:**

items: Handles user registration by hashing passwords with `bcrypt`.
Generates and sends a verification code via email using `nodemailer` with [Amazon SES](https://aws.amazon.com/ses/).

article.content: **Login Route:**

items: Manages user login, ensuring that the user exists and the password is correct.
Checks if the user's email is verified before allowing access.
Generates a **JWT** token for authenticated sessions.

article.content: **Verify Route:**

items: Handles email verification by matching the verification code.
Marks the user's email as verified upon successful verification.

article.content: **Forget Password:**

items: Sends an email with a token for password reset.
Allows the user to change their password if the provided token is correct.

article.content: This setup ensures a seamless and secure registration, login, and email verification process, adhering to modern JavaScript best practices.
Technology Stack
**Node.js:** Provides a robust and efficient backend for handling authentication processes.
**React:** A powerful library for building dynamic user interfaces, perfect for creating a responsive and interactive frontend.
**Tailwind CSS:** A utility-first CSS framework that streamlines the styling process, ensuring a consistent and visually appealing interface without custom CSS.
Diving Deeper into Node.js
Node.js is the backbone of this project, handling all the server-side logic and authentication processes. Hereâ€™s a closer look at why Node.js was the perfect choice for this system:
Scalability

Node.js is known for its ability to handle a large number of simultaneous connections with high throughput. This makes it ideal for an authentication system where multiple users might be registering or logging in at the same time.
Asynchronous Processing

With its non-blocking I/O operations, Node.js ensures that the server can handle multiple requests without being bogged down. This is crucial for maintaining a smooth user experience, especially during peak usage times.
Real-Time Capabilities

Node.js excels in real-time applications, making it perfect for an authentication system that requires immediate feedback and dynamic updates, such as real-time score updates and instant verification processes.
Robust Ecosystem

The Node.js ecosystem is rich with libraries and frameworks that simplify development. For instance, Express.js makes it easy to set up a web server, while Mongoose provides a straightforward way to interact with MongoDB.
Dive Into the Code

Curious about the implementation details? The full project is available on [my GitHub repository](https://github.com/abolfazlbzgh/email-authentication). Explore the codebase, examine the React components, and see how Tailwind CSS is applied to create a modern and responsive interface. This project provides valuable insights into contemporary web development techniques and practices.
Final Thoughts

Developing this email authentication system has been a rewarding experience, merging the reliability of **Node.js** with the elegance of **React** and **Tailwind CSS**. The result is a secure, efficient, and visually appealing authentication system. I'm excited to share it with you and look forward to your feedback.
Introduction

This Chrome extension, written as open-source, is available on [my GitHub](https://github.com/abolfazlbzgh/MPI-Road-Test-Helper). It helps find available driving test slots in Manitoba, Canada, listed on the [MPI Online Services](https://www.mpi.mb.ca/online-services/) site. When a slot matching your preferences is found, the extension notifies you via the [MPI Helper Telegram Bot](https://t.me/mpihelperbot).
Please follow our [Telegram channel](https://t.me/mpi_helper_support) for the latest updates.
User Manual
Using this extension involves three steps:

items: Install
Insert Information
Use

article.content: If you have already installed the extension, you do not need to install it again. Only proceed to the second step if you want to change your information.

items: To install, [click this link](navigate/codeDetail/mpi-install).
To enter or edit your information, [click this link](navigate/codeDetail/mpi-insert-information).
If you have already installed the extension and entered the information, [click this link](navigate/codeDetail/mpi-use).

article.content: Step 1: Download and Install the Extension

**Note:** If you have already installed the extension, you do not need to go through the following steps. To enter or edit your information, [click this link](navigate/codeDetail/mpi-insert-information).
All the steps to download and install the extension are demonstrated in the video below. Detailed explanations for each step are provided in the text following the video.
1. Download the extension zip file from the link below
[Click to download the extension](https://github.com/abolfazlbzgh/MPI-Road-Test-Helper/releases/download/v1.0/MPI-Road-Test-Helper-DragAndDropMe.zip)

2. Extract the downloaded file to your desired folder. You should see a folder named **MPI-Road-Test-Helper-DragAndDropMe**. If you change or delete this folder later, the extension will not work. Make sure to place it in a permanent location.
3. Open Chrome and click on the three dots in the top right corner as shown in the image. Then, select the **Manage Extensions** button from the menu.
Click according to the numbers
4. On the opened page, click on the **Developer mode** option as shown in the picture, and activate it.
5. Now, **drag and drop** the *MPI-Road-Test-Helper-DragAndDropMe folder* onto the Chrome extensions page as shown in the image.
Drag and drop the extracted file
6. Click on the extension icon and then click on the pin option. This will ensure that the extension icon is always visible in your Chrome toolbar, as shown in the image below.
Pin to Chrome toolbar
7. Turn on the extension as shown in the picture.
Turn on the extension
8. Enter ***chrome://settings/?search=active+tab*** in the Chrome address bar and press Enter to open the following page. Click the Add button on this page
9. In the pop-up that opens, click on *Add site manually* and enter ***www.mpi.mb.ca*** in the site section. Then, click the *Add* button.

Congratulations! You have successfully installed the extension. From now on, you don't need to repeat these steps. To enter or edit your information, [click this link](navigate/codeDetail/mpi-insert-information).

title: MPI Road Test Helper: Enter or Edit Information

article.content: Step 2: Enter or Edit Information

**Note**:If you have already entered your information, do not need to change it, and have connected the [Telegram bot](https://t.me/mpihelperbot) to the extension, [click on this](navigate/codeDetail/mpi-use) link to see how to use the extension.
The video below demonstrates all the steps to insert your information into the extension. Detailed explanations for each step are available in the text below the video.
1. Click on the extension icon and then select the **Insert Information** button, as shown in the image below.

2. On this page, enter your **date of birth**, **document number**, and **zip code**. You can also select the centers where you want to take the test and choose the available days from the list provided. Additionally, specify the time period during which you can participate in the test. Note that to receive a **license**, you must send a message to the [Telegram bot](https://t.me/mpihelperbot). Instructions on how to do this are provided in the next step.
3. To get the license, click on the link below to display the page. Then, click on the **Start** button.
[Click to use the Telegram bot](https://t.me/mpihelperbot)

4. Click on the **Get My License** button, then click on the text to copy your license to the clipboard. Note that each license has an expiration time. If it expires, you will need to obtain a new license and enter it into the extension.
5. Enter the received license into the designated section. Then, click on the **Check Your License** button. You should receive the following message in your Telegram.
You have successfully entered your information. Now, [click on this link](navigate/codeDetail/mpi-use) to proceed to the usage section.
Step 3: Usage
1. Click on the link below to access the Manitoba Public Insurance Online Service website.
[Manitoba Public Insurance Online Services](https://www.mpi.mb.ca/online-services/)

2. Wait for the following page to open. If it doesn't appear, check if the extension is enabled. On the page, click **I am not a bot** and then click the **Next** button. If you encounter an error after clicking Next, click on the date of birth icon and try again.
3. You will now see the page below. If you haven't selected a time before, you'll see the image above. If you have already selected a time, you will need to reschedule your appointment.

You should now receive a message in Telegram indicating that it is searching for available slots. No further action is required; you will be notified via Telegram about available times at test centers.

Please keep this Chrome tab open to ensure that the centers are checked automatically every 5 minutes.
Extension startup message

If a test center that matches your selected date, time, and locations is found, you will receive a message similar to the one below. When you see this message, **quickly** return to your Chrome page where the extension is running to reserve the available time. Note that you have only **one minute** to book the spot.

If an error occurs on your Chrome page, you will receive a message instructing you to go back to the Chrome page and click the **try again** or **Home** button. This will take you to the login page where you can re-enter your information in the second section.

If your license has **expired**, you will see this error. You will need to obtain a new license through the [Telegram bot](https://t.me/mpihelperbot) and then visit the information entry section using [this link](navigate/codeDetail/mpi-insert-information) **to enter your new license**.

If you need further assistance, have any feedback, or suggestions, you can send your message by clicking the menu button in the [Telegram bot](https://t.me/mpihelperbot) and selecting the **Contact** option. Thank you for following the steps so far!
